posts.title: English tartans
posts.subtitle: About English tartans
posts.author: nick-fiddes
posts.concept: An in-depth article about the history and development of English tartans, to be published on St George's day. This will focus on issues like similar patterns woven in England historically, and how the Celtic Fringe of England took on the idea of tartans from Scotland, and also how some English families or other organisations have developed their own tartans.
posts.summary: English tartans have a fascinating trajectory, intertwining with the better-known Scottish tartan tradition yet developing a character of their own. Although tartan is primarily identified with Scotland, England's engagement with tartan spans from ancient use of checkered cloth by Celtic peoples to a modern revival of regional and national patterns. This comprehensive overview examines the emergence and development of tartans in England – from historical origins and regional examples to influences of the textile industry, expressions of national identity, and contemporary design movements – all while preserving every detail of the rich historical narrative.
